title: a law is passed in the French National Assembly prohibiting the wearing of “ostentatious” religious signs in French public schools
Nicolas Sarkozy is elected president of France

location: Egypt, Libya, Yemen, Bahrain, and Syria
title: the onset of the Arab Spring, a series of antigovernment demonstrations and a popular uprising against autocratic governments in the Arab countries of Tunisia
François Hollande is elected president of France
French parliamentary elections. Both votes witness a massive vote for the Socialists by electors who identified themselves as Muslims
Ex-con and French jihadi Mehdi Nemmouche attacks visitors to the Jewish Museum of Belgium upon his return from the ISIS caliphate in Syria
the Kouachi brothers massacre the staff of Charlie Hebdo
Amedy Coulibaly attacks the Hyper Cacher supermarket in Porte de Vincennes
a huge demonstration takes place in Paris protesting the January 7–9 attacks; this is the largest demonstration in French history
Attacks on the Stade de France, several restaurants, and the Bataclan music hall in Paris leave 130 dead
